name: Forest Suites Resort at Heavenly Village

reviews.text: We took advantage of a LivingSocial promotion where we received a 2 room suite at a discount. The suite consisted of 2 queen beds, with one of the rooms also having a twin bed. There was also a sofa bed in the living room. The suite comfortable housed us and the kids. The bathrooms were a bit dated. The service in the hotel was great as were the activities for the kids (roasting marshmallows, crafts in the morning, etc.). We happened to check in at the time of the wine/cheese party, so that was a nice greeting. Breakfast consisted of coffee, juices, cereals, bagels, eggs (powdered?), bacon and potatoes. While a bit busy, there were plenty of places to sit for our family of 5. They have a "green" program which lets you receive a bottle of wine or snack package in lieu of housekeeping. I'm not sure how this is green as opposed to labor cost savings, but we did not mind as we don't swap out linens/towels during our stays. The hotel is located right behind Heavenly Village, so its in walking distance to the bars/restaurants in the village as well as the casinos. The hotel staff recommended visits to local beaches and the Taylor Creek Visitor Center, both of which were hits the kids. We enjoyed our stay and will be back.
reviews.title: LivingSocial prompted visit paid off in a great stay and memories

reviews.text: The retreat is just enough off the traffic path to be quiet and serene. There is a doorway in the lobby to the stairs of the Gondolas for Heavenly Valley Ski area. (runs summer and winter).
reviews.title: A perfect retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience was good from the telephone call to check on availability prior to buying a fabulous Travel Zoo package through our checkout following our 2 night stay.
reviews.title: Dissapointed. Go with the suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 Bedroom suites are huge. King in one, full plus twin or queen in the other, plus queen pullout in living room. Two baths, both large. Full kitchen, equipped with dishes, silverware, pots/pans and utensils. Bring your food (Raleys just down the street) and make a full meal if you are so inclined. Dining table seats 6. Two TVs, good internet reception(free). Four could stay here for months and not be crowded. Leather chairs/sofa, plenty of lamps so you don't need to feel your way around the unit. And, re Onepinoy's review - yes, the decor is older, but primarily it is "lodge type" not high tech new plastic -- the dining table is actually wood). This is a summer in the woods/mountains and ski resort area, you know.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Excellent Location to Heavenly Village, Fantastic Service

reviews.text: Full breakfast, quite good with scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, juices, cereals, toast/bagles, etc.
reviews.title: Bring low expectations

reviews.text: My wife and I have 4 kids, so finding a suitable place to stay can be tough. Forest Suites Resort was better than we could've expected! The suite felt like a spacious cabin. With one room having one queen, a twin, and enough room for a playpen for our littlest one, and another room just for mommy and daddy, it was fantastic! Another very pleasant surprise was the first-rate service the staff provided. When I went to get checked in there was someone ahead of me, and another employee came out of the back to help me. This happened again when I had a question the next day. Very cool!
reviews.title: Perfect for our family of 6!

reviews.text: We have stayed here several times. The 2 bedroom condo is great! The breakfast is good and the pool/spa is good too. Definitely will be coming here many more times. Great value for the price. The full kitchen in the condo was great, and Raley's across the street. Made the family trip wonderful!
reviews.title: Great!!!

reviews.text: We first chose to stay here two years ago because my kids do not like to eat out for the most part. We figured it would save us money and be more convenient if we got a suite here that had a full kitchen for us to cook. It worked out well! We have stayed there 5 times in three years and we go back every time!
reviews.title: Great Rooms and Locations for Families

reviews.text: We have seen a few things as others mentioned with being an older room, but between last year and this year, many of those things were resolved and the room we stayed in had upgraded furniture. (We stayed in this room last year as well)
reviews.title: great place!
A great location and "value" property!
reviews.text: Our room had an entrance right out to the pool, which my kids LOVED! We swam every day we were there. They make it very family friendly and are very responsive. I also like how they have a choice of full service or minimal service with a gift. We don't need our sheets changed every day, but they still gave towel service and replenished amenities as needed.

Great location, wonderful staff and good facilities. Stayed at this property for 4 nights at the end of the summer holidays. The rooms was spacious, for myself, my wife and 3 kids. Location in the centre of Heavenly made everything easy to walk to. The kids lovely the swimming pools and the hotel had lots of activities each day for them. The breakfast room was busy, but always everything available. Overall an excellent place to stay in South Lake Tahoe.
reviews.title: Forest Suites, Tahoe
Surprisingly pleasant!
reviews.text: We usually stay at casinos (rooms comp'd) in south lake Tahoe but decided to book a room to stay with a group celebrating our friends' wedding. Although I started getting nervous about what the room was going to look like after using the elevator & walking down the hallway, I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the 2 bedroom room. The decor looked a little "tired" but the second bedroom had a queen bed & a twin bed which was nice so my 2 girls didn't fight with having to share a bed (altho one of them could have slept on the pull out couch in the front room). The location was fabulous (right behind the very nice Marriott timberlodge), so dining & shopping was very close by, as were the casinos (all walking distance). Altho we drove to the public beach (in wedding attire), it is definitely within walking distance. The continental breakfast was ok. But given this wasn't a timeshare, we were also pleasantly surprised to see they had free wine/cheese hour, family movie nights & campfire/s'mores (tho we didn't have time to check all if this out). Our kids enjoyed the pool/spa too!
Don't know that we will necessarily return but we were definitely satisfied with our stay!
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: Well I booked this room on Travelocity and was guaranteed 2 beds as I was going up with a buddy. When we got there to check in, they said we were in an upgraded king room with a pull out sofa. Since most pull out sofas have little padding and are terrible to sleep on we declined the upgrade and we got 2 beds in Room 3XX.
reviews.title: We had a great girls weekend here

reviews.text: So I am not sure how nice the main lodge rooms are but the strip of Rooms that are 301-317 are a remnant of some old motel and is cobbled together with the rest of the resort. Don't stay in one of these rooms as they are dated and in bad need of maintenance and upgrades. The fan in our bathroom sounded like it was going to die. The walls are paper thin and sice there are carports underneath, a lot people ulling in at all hours and then talking very loudly as they walk to their rooms. The beds are really soft and I had a backache my second day.
reviews.title: WORST NIGHTMARE

reviews.text: The hotel was very accommodating to my needs. Nice place to stay. Very reasonably priced. Bring your own pillow though. They are as flat as a pancake. Very close proximity to the Heavenly village. Close enough to walk to the lake, next to the casinos. They have lots of activities like a marshmallow roast and wine and cheese parties.
reviews.title: Very accomodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband surprised me with a trip to Lake Tahoe for our honeymoon. Originally we were supposed to go to Ireland but due to work related reasons we decided to stay closer to home (Reno). Upon arrival I didn't quite know what to think. The property looked a bit worn on the outside but I quickly changed my mind when my husband showed me to our room, a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen and rustic cabin decor. The room was spotless. It was so clean and comfortable I could totally see a family spending a week here on there ski vacation. A nice perk was a free bottle of wine for not needing to have our room cleaned one day. It is the perfect property for families because the hotel has arranged fun activities for every age. We enjoyed the wine and cheese social in the evening and the breakfast in the morning. We also enjoyed the pool and spa. I would like to come back and bring our son so he could take part in the arts and crafts activities the hotel offers, pony rides, ice cream socials, and evening story time and marshmallow roast around the campfire. There is also a fitness center on site, massage therapy available, family movie nights and fitness classes during certain times of the week. We had a great stay and urge customers to get back the initial facade because this place has everything! Loved it. Will be back! Thank you Forest Suites for a perfect honeymoon.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, wonderful service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just the two of us we never book a suite but the wedding we were attending arranged for one bedroom suites - loved the spaciousness! So worth it. Turned into a relaxating mini-vacation, best nights' sleep. Husband woke up early and watched tv in living room. No time for the wine tasting or 's'mores but used the kitchen. A cookie sheet in the oven was great for reheating pizza from Blue Dog Gourmet Pizza across the street to crispy perfection. Entire staff was friendly, helpful and welcoming. Suggessted breakfast buffet before 8 to avoid big crowds. Very few people, mounds of piping hot items and good selection of cold as well. Really liked the option of just clean towels and trash emptied in exchange for a gift - chose the movie package: 2 sodas, microwave popcorn, chocolate bar and bag of candy. Some reviewers say its old and needs updating - the important thing is it is CLEAN! Told our son who sometimes works in Tahoe and learned he always stays here. We will go back.
reviews.title: Heavenly stay at Forest Suites

reviews.text: Everything was just great for our family. We've stayed in one bedroom suite and are going to return here next time in our visit lake Tahoe. I have no idea how it is in other kind of rooms. This one perfectly match our wishes. Guys, I'd recommend you just ignore negative reviews of these suites.
reviews.title: The best stay we had in South Lake Tahoe

reviews.text: Over the last 15 days my family and I have had the chance to stay at the Forest Suites Resort in two separate stays. We were traveling through while going to a family wedding and then traveling through to come home. We set up 2 separate reservations. Both we executed flawlessly. This trip we did not take advantage of the area or the other amenities other than the buffet breakfast. The breakfast was piping hot and fresh. When checking in the first night the front desk recommended a time for breakfast when it would be less crowded. He determined this by the events going on in town and the time they started. We walked right up got plates of steaming delicious breakfast. He was correct. The lobby was pack upon check out about 30 minutes later. This was a nice thoughtful gesture.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

description: Location, Location, Location! Forest Suites Resort at Heavenly Village is a South Lake Tahoe resort nestled in intimate alpine environment located less than 100 yards away from Heavenly Ski Gondola and Heavenly Village. All of our over sized South Lake Tahoe resort suites sleep 4 to 6 adults. We are a few minute walk to the casinos, and a few blocks to the crystal clear waters of Lake Tahoe. Guests staying at Forest Suites Resort will experience updated rooms & furnishings, new decor & upgraded amenities. Our guests will experience high-speed wireless internet, hot American style breakfast buffet, mid-week nightly wine and cheese receptions, weekend child activities, “Green” exercise classes, movie nights, an XBOX game center & events throughout the entire year for the entire family to enjoy.
